intro: Ossaea urbaniana, commonly known as the urbanian sandmat, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Ossaea urbaniana thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native environment.
